CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 28, 1958, pg. 8, reads: "Entertain Florida Teen-Ager - Mrs. Juanita Taylor of Homewood Ave. entertained her niece, Betty Jean Anderson, of Jacksonville, Fla., at the Greene Hearthe [Hearth] where the pretty young miss met a number of Pittsburgh's young set. She will spend the summer in Pittsburgh, and hopes to return next year to study at Pitt after she is graduated from high school. Left to right, standing, are Patricia Jackson, Mary Nicholson, Morgan Thomas Jr., Judith Hopson, Mary Ann Harris, Betty Jean Anderson, Henry A. Peyton, Marciel Rhyne, Barbara E. Williams, Clarence C. Walker, Judith Brooks, Mrs. Earsley F. Kincaid, one of aids, and Janice Peyton. Pouring tea are, left, Mrs. Ora Sims, and right, hostess, Mrs. Taylor. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Ora Sims and Juanita Taylor seated at table with tea service, and standing from left: Patricia Jackson, Mary Nicholson, Morgan Thomas Jr., Judith Hopson, Mary Ann Harris, Betty Jean Anderson, Henry A. Peyton, Marciel Rhyne, Barbara E. Williams, Clarence C. Walker, Judith Brooks, and Janice Peyton, in Greene Hearth, another version
